title: Shatrughan Slams Mukesh Khanna Over Sonakshi-Ramayan Row: 'Who Appointed Him Guardian Of Hindu?' | Viral - News18
summary:
Shatrughan Sinha Criticizes Mukesh Khanna for Attacks on Daughter Sonakshi Regarding Ramayan

Date: December 17, 2024

Source: Viral

In a recent conflict, Shatrughan Sinha vocally opposed Mukesh Khanna's repeated criticisms of his daughter Sonakshi over her memory lapse regarding the Ramayan during a game show.

  • Sonakshi Sinha confronted Mukesh Khanna after he remarked on her forgetting a detail about Ramayan on Kaun Banega Crorepati.
  • Shatrughan Sinha questioned Mukesh Khanna's authority to judge and labeled him 'guardian of the Hindu religion'.
  • Shatrughan emphasized that forgetting a question about the Ramayan does not undermine Sonakshi's identity as a Hindu.
“Not answering a question on the Ramayan doesn’t disqualify Sonakshi from being a good Hindu.” - Shatrughan Sinha

Shatrughan Sinha expressed pride in his children, affirming Sonakshi's accomplishments and dismissing the need for validation through religious trivia.
newTitle: Shatrughan Sinha Criticizes Mukesh Khanna for Attacks on Daughter Sonakshi Regarding Ramayan

title: Kapil Sharma reacts to backlash against his alleged ‘racist jibes’ at Atlee on The Great Indian Kapil Show - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kapil Sharma Reacts to Backlash Against His Alleged ‘Racist Jibes’ at Atlee on The Great Indian Kapil Show

Date: Dec 17, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The controversy began when filmmaker Atlee appeared on The Great Indian Kapil Show to promote his upcoming movie, Baby John. Kapil Sharma faced backlash for joking about Atlee's appearance, prompting him to request viewers to watch the entire episode before forming opinions.

  • Atlee participated in the show alongside actors Varun Dhawan, Keerthy Suresh, and Wamiqa Gabbi.
  • Kapil asked Atlee a question regarding meeting a star for the first time, which led to criticism for being insensitive.
  • Atlee emphasized the importance of judging people by their talent rather than appearance, which many found inappropriate in context.
  • Kapil publicly addressed the criticism on social media, urging people not to misinterpret his remarks.
  • Responses on social media were mixed, with some fans defending Kapil while others condemned his comment as body shaming and insensitive.
“Dear sir, can you pls explain me where n when I talked about looks in this video? pls don’t spread hate on social media.” - Kapil Sharma

The incident generated significant discussion online, raising concerns about humor's boundaries in relation to race and appearance.
newTitle: Kapil Sharma Responds to Criticism Over Alleged Racist Remarks towards Atlee

title: Top Highest Grossing Indian Films Worldwide: Allu Arjun starrer Pushpa 2 overtakes RRR for Third - PINKVILLA
summary:
Pushpa 2 Surpasses RRR as the Third Highest-Grossing Indian Film Worldwide

Updated on: Dec 17, 2024 | Source: Pinkvilla

Pushpa 2 has claimed the title of the third highest-grossing Indian film worldwide, surpassing RRR with a total gross of approximately Rs. 1259 crore.

  • Pushpa 2 generated Rs. 33 crore approximately on its 2nd Monday, bringing its worldwide box office total to Rs. 1259 crore.
  • The film's domestic gross is Rs. 1039.50 crore, while the overseas total is Rs. 219.50 crore.
  • Pushpa 2 is now the second highest-grossing film in India, yet remains outside the top fifteen in overseas grosses.
  • Despite its success, it is predicted that Pushpa 2 is unlikely to surpass the Rs. 1744 crore gross of Baahubali 2.
  • The current highest-grossing Indian films are: Dangal (1910.00 cr.), Baahubali: The Conclusion (1744.00 cr.), and Pushpa: The Rule (1259.00 cr.).
“Pushpa 2 is favourite to become the highest-grossing film in India, beating Baahubali 2.”

In conclusion, Pushpa 2’s record-setting performance reflects the film's strong appeal and the competitive landscape of Indian cinema.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Surpasses RRR as the Third Highest-Grossing Indian Film Worldwide

title: Why SC restrained TM Krishna from claiming award named after MS Subbulakshmi. 'Added fuel to fire' - ThePrint
summary:
Supreme Court Prevents T.M. Krishna from Claiming M.S. Subbulakshmi Award

Publication Date: Date Not Specified Source: The Print

Well-known Carnatic musician T.M. Krishna has been restrained by the Supreme Court from claiming the Sangita Kalanidhi M.S. Subbulakshmi Award, awarded by the Madras Music Academy, following an appeal by Subbulakshmi’s grandson.

  • The Supreme Court issued a notice regarding the award conferred upon Krishna.
  • Subbulakshmi’s grandson, V. Shrinivasan, challenged the Madras High Court's decision that allowed the award to be given.
  • The Supreme Court indicated that Krishna's comments about Subbulakshmi were disrespectful and necessary to address.
  • Krishna faces accusations of making derogatory remarks about Subbulakshmi in his writings.
“This is a sensitive and important issue.” - Supreme Court Bench

The controversy highlights a broader conflict regarding the recognition and memory of M.S. Subbulakshmi in the field of Carnatic music.
newTitle: Supreme Court Prevents T.M. Krishna from Claiming M.S. Subbulakshmi Award

Overall, Dacoit promises to be an exciting addition to Mrunal Thakur's and Adivi Sesh's film journeys, highlighting the complexities of love and crime.

title: Kangana Ranaut reacts to Kapoor family meeting PM Modi; says she has also requested an audience with him - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kangana Ranaut Comments on Kapoor Family's Meeting with PM Modi

Date: Dec 17, 2024 Source: HT Entertainment Desk

Kangana Ranaut has expressed her views regarding the recent meeting between the Kapoor family and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, highlighting the need for guidance in the film industry.

  • Kangana believes the film industry is vulnerable and underutilized as a soft power.
  • She criticized the lack of guidance in the industry, making its members susceptible to negative influences.
  • Kangana has requested an audience with PM Modi, emphasizing the importance of recognition for the film industry.
  • Up next, she stars in the self-directed film Emergency, portraying Indira Gandhi, set to release in 2025.
“They need to be a part of mainstream industries... we make so many films and generate so much revenue.”

Kangana's remarks reflect a broader conversation about the film industry's role in society and its relationship with political figures.

  • The film is expected to cross Rs. 700 crore nett in Hindi.

title: What Nita Ambani wrote for luxury Bengaluru store after saree shopping: ‘Wonderful to be…’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Nita Ambani's Visit to Luxury Saree Store in Bengaluru

Date: Dec 17, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Nita Ambani, the chairperson of the Reliance Foundation, was spotted shopping for sarees at The House of Angadi, a luxury textile store in Bengaluru. Her visit garnered attention as videos showed her greeting fans before entering the store.

  • Nita Ambani wore a dark blue co-ord set and was seen greeting people as she entered the store.
  • The House of Angadi specializes in handloom sarees and has a history of 600 years.
  • The store gained fame when Deepika Padukone wore one of its sarees for her wedding.
  • Nita Ambani left a note in the visitor’s book expressing her appreciation, stating: “Wonderful to be here and experience our Indian heritage.”
“Thank you Mrs Nita Ambani for your warmth and patronage,” the official Instagram account of The House of Angadi stated.

Nita Ambani’s visit highlights the rich textile heritage of India and brings attention to traditional weaves in contemporary fashion.
newTitle: Nita Ambani's Visit to Luxury Saree Store in Bengaluru

summary:
AR Rahman Mourns the Loss of Tabla Maestro Zakir Hussain

Date: Dec 17, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

AR Rahman paid tribute to the late Ustad Zakir Hussain, a renowned tabla maestro, expressing his grief and regret for not collaborating more during their careers.

  • Rahman shared images with Zakir on Instagram, showcasing his respect and sorrow through emojis.
  • He described Zakir's influence on music as immeasurable and celebrated his contributions to Indian classical music.
  • Rahman revealed plans for a collaborative album with Zakir, lamenting that they did not work together as much as they could have.
  • Zakir Hussain passed away in San Francisco at the age of 73 after battling a chronic lung disease.
  • Prime Minister Narendra Modi also mourned Zakir's death, highlighting his revolutionary impact on Indian classical music.
“Inna lillahi wa inna ilayhi raji'un. Zakir Bhai was an inspiration, a towering personality who elevated the tabla to global acclaim. His loss is immeasurable for all of us.” - AR Rahman

The music community remembers Zakir Hussain as a legend who transcended genres, leaving behind a legacy that will inspire future generations.
newTitle: AR Rahman Mourns the Loss of Tabla Maestro Zakir Hussain

Date: Dec 17, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Naga Chaitanya, who recently married Sobhita Dhulipala, shares his desire for her to speak to him in Telugu to improve his language skills and connect more deeply.

  • Naga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala got married on December 4 at Annapurna Studios in Hyderabad.
  • Chaitanya was born in Hyderabad but grew up in Chennai, speaking both Telugu and Tamil.
